availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James W. Smith (Clay County clerk/Circuit Clerk)

body.p: Native of Clay County, Kentucky. Worked as a clerk in Clay County in 1860. Lived in the household of John Lucas who owned a grocery in 1860. At some point in the 1860s, he became the clerk of the Clay Circuit Court.

Spouse: Kitty Smith
Children: Richard Smith

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Clay County, page 1.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedule, Clay County, Precinct 1, page 62.
